title: Mom, 23, arrested for murder after she 'beat to death her toddler son because he soiled his diaper'
text:
A mother-of-two from Georgia has been charged with murdering her 20-month-old son, telling investigators she beat the toddler because she was angry he had soiled his diaper.

Trinity Pittman, of Palmetto, was arrested on Saturday on counts of felony murder and first-degree child cruelty.

The 23-year-old Pittman took her son Conner Perry to a hospital emergency room Friday night in Newnan, saying he had fallen off a trampoline.

Trinity Pittman, 23 (left), has been charged with felony murder and child cruelty in the beating death of her 20-month-old son, Conner Perry (pictured right as a baby with older brother)

Pittman allegedly confessed to beating her son until he passed out because she was angry that he had soiled his diaper

However, medical staff at Piedmont Newnan Hospital became suspicious because the child’s injuries were inconsistent with that story.

According to warrants obtained by the channel 11 Alive, Conner's abdominal cavity was filled with blood and his lungs were filling up with fluids.

The toddler also suffered a broken jaw, cuts and bruises to his face, had several teeth missing teeth and had bleeding on his brain.

Conner was later transferred to Children's Healthcare of Atlanta, where he died of his injuries at 11pm.

The warrants state that Pittman later confessed to hitting the child several times in anger over the dirty diaper. At one point during the attack, Conner fell and hit his head on the floor, then 'went to sleep,' according the boy's mother.

When Pittman took Conner to the hospital, she told staff that the toddler got injured while jumping on a trampoline. Medics said Conner's abdominal cavity was filled with blood and his lungs were filling up with fluids

Hours after the beating, Pittman headed off to work, leaving Conner and his four-year-old brother in the care of her boyfriend, 24-year-old Jeremy Davis.

Pittman allegedly lied to Davis about Conner's trampoline fall as well.

The boyfriend later called Pittman, telling her that Conner woke up vomiting and having trouble breathing.

An autopsy report revealed that Conner Perry's body also showed signs of old injuries, reported Fox 5 Atlanta.

'Trinity Pittman exhibited general disregard for the welfare of her own child Conner Perry and acted out of personal spite towards the child leading to physical injury,' the warrant states.

Pittman made her initial court appearance on Sunday and was denied bond.

Pittman's surviving child is currently staying with relatives.
description: Trinity Pittman, 23, from Georgia, has been charged with felony murder and child cruelty in the beating death of her 20-month-old son, Conner Perry, which the mom tried to pass off as an accident.
